com.plasmoxy.cvfxbase

Class CVFXController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.plasmoxy.cvfxbase.CVFXController

  • public abstract class CVFXController
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract controller class with all the logic of OpenCV and stuff. This class is instantiated externally using CVFXApp instance, NOT in fxml.

    How to use this class :

    • extend this class to create your controller class
    • in the subclass, override methods init and process methods
    • in init method you can do element hiding, set texts of buttons/labels, set default camera id, set default value of sliders, etc...
    • in process method you can work with opencv images, this method gets executed on every single frame.
    • you can override methods slider?Changed, toggle?Changed and button?Changed to run code when there is user input

    My notes which are not important to the user :

    • because Mat is native object, null check doesn't work, always initialize it with new Mat() instead of null ( it was a big bug in my code )
    • this used jfoenix but then i just modified it to native fx node classes because the base is same ( so you can but dont have to use jfoenix or any other fxml library )
    • getClass() called anywhere apparently returns the highest inherited subclass of specified instance
    • to get type of field, use getType() on Field instance instead, getClass() returns Field.class
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Plasmoxy

        text - The actual text string which should be set.

      • getInfoText

        Returns the text of a infoText list by given position
        Parameters:
        position - The position/number of the text field
        Returns:
        The text string.

      • init

        protected abstract void init()
        The abstract initialization method, has to be overridden in subclass. By the time this method is called, all the fx stuff should be already initialized. USE THIS METHOD AS A MAIN METHOD IN YOUR CVFXBase PROJECT ( respectively, instead of controller constructor ) ( although feel free add your own constructor, but the superclass constructor must me called )

      • initAfterShow

        protected void initAfterShow()
        This is an another initialization method. It is called when the JavaFX Stage is shown (resp. rendered). This method isn't mandatory.

      • closeController

        protected void closeController()
        Gets called by App when it's closing. It stops the rendering ( and closes the capture device )

      • updateInfoLabel

        public void updateInfoLabel()
        Updates the info label ( concatenates the Strings in infoText field )

      • process

        protected abstract void process(org.opencv.core.Mat mainframe,
                                org.opencv.core.Mat alphaframe,
                                org.opencv.core.Mat betaframe)
        This important method gets called on render of every frame. Put your opencv code here ( you have all 3 Mats to work with ).
        Parameters:
        mainframe - frame which gets rendered in MAIN view
        alphaframe - frame which gets rendered in ALPHA view
        betaframe - frame which gets rendered in BETA view

      • log

        protected void log(java.lang.String text)
        This method is used internally for logging and you can use it too. It checks if logging is active and then prints stuff.
        Parameters:
        text - text to log
